snippet.title: Suspicious death in Cooktown
snippet.content: POLICE say they are treating as suspicious the death of a woman whose body was found in Cooktown this morning. Detectives investigating the disappearance of 42-year-old Donna Louise Steele located a woman's body earlier today. It comes three days after the last sighting of Ms Steele. On Tuesday, August 2 she was at a Parkinson Street caravan park and the following day she was seen at a Helen St independent supermarket around 12.15pm. Around 5.20am today, police responded to reports of a woman's body being located at Leggett's Crossing, Endeavour Valley Road. A crime scene has been declared with detectives and specialist police in attendance. Police are treating the woman's death as suspicious and have set up an investigation centre at Cairns Criminal Investigation Branch. Investigations are ongoing and detectives are appealing for any witnesses to come forward or anyone with information.
